intro: Rupestrea johnwurdackiana, commonly known as the John Wurdack's rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, arid environments. Its leaves are usually succulent, helping it store water, while its roots are specialized for nutrient absorption from mineral-rich soils. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
